documents.title: Study Permit Requirements
documents.content:
Study Permit Requirements for Canada:

1. Letter of Acceptance: Must have acceptance letter from Designated Learning Institution (DLI)
2. Proof of Financial Support: Must prove you can pay tuition fees + living expenses + return transportation
   - Living expenses: CAD $10,000/year (or $833/month) plus tuition
   - Additional $4,000 for first family member, $3,000 for each additional member
3. No Criminal Record: Police certificate may be required
4. Medical Exam: Required if staying >6 months or work in health/childcare
5. Intent to Leave: Must prove you'll leave Canada when permit expires
6. Biometrics: Required for most applicants
7. Quebec Acceptance Certificate (CAQ): Required for studies in Quebec

Processing Times: Vary by country, check IRCC website for current estimates.

documents.title: Work Permit Types and Requirements
documents.content:
Work Permit Categories:

1. Employer-Specific Work Permit:
   - Requires Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA) in most cases
   - Job offer from Canadian employer required
   - Valid for specific employer, location, and duration

2. Open Work Permit:
   - Not job-specific
   - Available for spouses of skilled workers/students, IEC participants, PGWP holders
   - Post-Graduation Work Permit (PGWP): Valid 8 months to 3 years based on program length

3. Global Talent Stream:
   - For high-skilled workers in tech occupations
   - Priority processing (2-week standard)
   - LMIA-exempt categories available

Requirements:
- Prove you'll leave Canada when permit expires
- Financial resources to support family
- Clean criminal record
- Good health (medical exam)
- Not plan to work for ineligible employer

documents.title: F-1 Student Visa Requirements
documents.source_authority: U.S. Department of State - Bureau of Consular Affairs
documents.content:
F-1 Student Visa Requirements:

1. SEVIS Registration: Must pay SEVIS I-901 fee ($350)
2. Form I-20: Certificate of Eligibility from SEVP-approved school
3. Online Nonimmigrant Visa Application (DS-160)
4. Interview: Required for most applicants aged 14-79
5. Documentation:
   - Passport valid for 6 months beyond stay
   - Form I-20
   - DS-160 confirmation
   - Application fee payment receipt ($185)
   - Photo (if upload fails)
   - Academic records: Transcripts, diplomas, test scores
   - Financial evidence: Bank statements, scholarships, sponsor letters

6. English Proficiency: Must demonstrate sufficient English skills
7. Home Ties: Must prove intent to return home after studies

Work Restrictions:
- On-campus: Maximum 20 hours/week during term
- Off-campus: Requires authorization (CPT/OPT)

documents.title: USA Visa Types Overview
documents.source_authority: U.S. Department of State - Bureau of Consular Affairs
documents.content:
USA Visa Types:

**Nonimmigrant Visas (Temporary):**

1. **F-1 Student Visa**: For academic studies at SEVP-approved schools
   - Requires Form I-20 from school
   - SEVIS fee required
   - Work restrictions apply

2. **H-1B Specialty Occupation Visa**: For workers in specialty occupations
   - Requires bachelor's degree or equivalent
   - Employer sponsorship required
   - Annual cap: 65,000 (plus 20,000 for advanced degrees)

3. **L-1 Intracompany Transferee**: For employees transferring within multinational company
   - L-1A for executives/managers
   - L-1B for specialized knowledge workers

4. **O-1 Extraordinary Ability**: For individuals with extraordinary ability
   - Sciences, arts, education, business, athletics
   - Requires sustained national or international acclaim

5. **E-2 Treaty Investor**: For investors from treaty countries
   - Substantial investment in U.S. business
   - Must be from treaty country

6. **TN NAFTA Professional**: For professionals from Canada/Mexico
   - Under NAFTA/USMCA agreement
   - Specific professional occupations

7. **B-1/B-2 Visitor Visa**: For business (B-1) or tourism (B-2)
   - Temporary visits
   - No work authorization

8. **J-1 Exchange Visitor**: For exchange programs
   - Students, researchers, teachers, au pairs
   - Subject to 2-year home residency requirement

**Immigrant Visas (Permanent):**

1. **EB-1 Priority Workers**: Extraordinary ability, outstanding professors/researchers, multinational executives
2. **EB-2 Advanced Degree Professionals**: Advanced degree or exceptional ability
3. **EB-3 Skilled Workers**: Professionals, skilled workers, unskilled workers
4. **EB-5 Investor**: Investment of $800,000-$1,050,000 creating jobs
5. **Family-Based**: Immediate relatives, family preference categories

For detailed requirements, consult USCIS or U.S. Department of State official websites.

documents.title: H-1B Specialty Occupation Visa
documents.content:
H-1B Specialty Occupation Visa:

Requirements:
1. Specialty Occupation: Position requiring theoretical/practical application of specialized knowledge
   - Minimum bachelor's degree or equivalent in specific specialty

2. Employer Sponsorship: U.S. employer must file petition (Form I-129)

3. Labor Condition Application (LCA): Approved by Department of Labor
   - Must pay prevailing wage or actual wage, whichever is higher

4. Cap Limitations:
   - Regular cap: 65,000 visas/year
   - Advanced degree exemption: 20,000 additional for master's+ from US institutions
   - Lottery system when petitions exceed cap (first week of April)

5. Validity: Initial 3 years, extendable to 6 years maximum

Alternatives:
- L-1: Intracompany transferees
- O-1: Individuals with extraordinary ability
- E-2: Treaty investors (for treaty countries)
- TN: NAFTA professionals (Canada/Mexico)

documents.title: Student Route (formerly Tier 4)
documents.content:
UK Student Visa (Student Route):

Eligibility:
1. Course Requirements:
   - Full-time course leading to degree level or above (RQF level 6+)
   - Minimum 15 hours/week organized daytime study
   - Approved education provider with 'student sponsor' license

2. Confirmation of Acceptance for Studies (CAS):
   - Unique reference number from sponsoring institution
   - Valid for 6 months from issue

3. Financial Requirements:
   - Course fees for 1 year (or entire course if <1 year)
   - Living costs: £1,334/month (London) or £1,023/month (outside London)
   - Must show funds for 28 consecutive days before application

4. English Language: CEFR level B2 for degree level, B1 for below degree

5. ATAS Certificate: Required for sensitive subjects (science, engineering)

Application Fee: £490
Immigration Health Surcharge: £470/year

Work Rights:
- Degree level: Max 20 hours/week term time, full-time holidays
- Below degree: Max 10 hours/week

documents.title: Student Visa (Subclass 500)
documents.content:
Student Visa (Subclass 500):

Requirements:
1. Enrollment: Confirmation of Enrollment (CoE) from CRICOS-registered course
2. Genuine Temporary Entrant (GTE): Must prove genuine intention to stay temporarily
3. Financial Capacity:
   - 12 months living costs: AUD $21,041
   - Course fees (12 months)
   - Travel costs: AUD $2,000-$3,000 depending on location
   - Alternative: Evidence of parental income (AUD $62,222/year)

4. English Proficiency:
   - IELTS: 5.5 overall (or 5.0 with 10 weeks ELICOS, or 4.5 with 20 weeks)
   - TOEFL, PTE, Cambridge also accepted

5. Health Insurance: Overseas Student Health Cover (OSHC) for entire stay

6. Health and Character: Medical exams and police certificates

7. Welfare Arrangements: Under 18 requires approved accommodation/custody

Visa Fee: AUD $650 (main applicant)

Work Rights: 48 hours per fortnight during term, unlimited during breaks

documents.title: Student Visa and Residence Permit
documents.content:
German Student Visa Process:

1. University Admission: Acceptance letter from German university
2. Blocked Account (Sperrkonto):
   - €11,208 per year (€934/month) in blocked account
   - Providers: Expatrio, Fintiba, Deutsche Bank

3. Health Insurance: Mandatory for enrollment and residence permit

4. Visa Application Documents:
   - Valid passport
   - Biometric photos
   - Admission letter
   - Proof of financial means (blocked account)
   - Academic certificates (translated and apostilled)
   - Language proficiency proof (German/English depending on course)
   - Motivation letter
   - CV/Resume

5. Residence Permit: Apply at local Ausländerbehörde within 90 days of arrival

Processing Time: 6-12 weeks

Work Rights:
- 120 full days or 240 half days per year
- Student assistant jobs unlimited

documents.title: B/4 Work Visa for Skilled Workers
documents.content:
Israel Work Visa (B/4) for Construction and Caregiving:

Bilateral Agreements:
- India-Israel agreement for 10,000 Indian workers in construction
- Additional agreements for nursing/caregiving staff

Requirements:
1. Employer Sponsorship: Israeli employer must obtain permit from Ministry of Labor

2. Documentation:
   - Valid passport (minimum 6 months validity)
   - Medical clearance from approved panel physicians
   - Police clearance certificate (PCC) from India
   - Work experience certificates (minimum 2 years for construction)
   - Educational qualifications attested

3. Medical Tests: HIV, Hepatitis B, TB screening mandatory

4. Training: Pre-departure orientation mandatory

5. Contract: Must specify wages, conditions, duration (typically 1 year renewable)

Processing:
- Employer applies for work permit in Israel
- Upon approval, worker applies for B/4 visa at Israeli embassy
- Visa valid for single entry, converted to temporary residence upon arrival

Rights and Protections:
- Health insurance provided by employer
- Housing or allowance provided
- Coverage under Israeli labor laws

documents.title: Visa Process for Working in Israel
documents.source_authority: PIBA (Population and Immigration Authority of Israel)
documents.content:
Visa Process for Working in Israel:

Step-by-step process:

1. Job Offer: Secure a job offer from a PIBA-verified Israeli employer. Employer must have valid authorization to hire foreign workers.

2. Work Permit Application: Your employer applies through PIBA (Population and Immigration Authority). Processing time: 30-45 business days (non-guaranteed, may vary). Application must include all required documentation.

3. Medical Examination: Complete medical fitness certificate from authorized medical center. Must be conducted at PIBA-approved facilities. Valid for 6 months from issue date.

4. Required Documentation:
   - Valid passport (minimum 2 years validity from visa issue date)
   - Educational certificates (attested)
   - Experience certificates (minimum 2-3 years for most categories)
   - Police clearance certificate (from home country)
   - Medical fitness certificate
   - Passport-sized photographs

5. Visa Processing: PIBA reviews your application. Background checks are conducted. Employer verification is completed.

6. Final Approval: Receive work visa approval. Travel arrangements can be made. Entry visa must be obtained from Israeli consulate.

Important: This is general guidance only. Procedures may vary by visa category and individual circumstances. Always consult official sources.

Official Contacts:
- NSDC India: +91-11-4747-4700, info@nsdcindia.org
- PIBA Israel: +972-2-629-4666, piba@piba.gov.il

documents.title: Express Entry System
documents.content:
Express Entry for Permanent Residency:

Programs:
1. Federal Skilled Worker Program (FSWP)
2. Federal Skilled Trades Program (FSTP)
3. Canadian Experience Class (CEC)

Process:
1. Create Express Entry profile
2. Get Comprehensive Ranking System (CRS) score
3. Enter Express Entry pool
4. Receive Invitation to Apply (ITA) if score is high enough
5. Submit complete application within 60 days
6. Processing: 6 months standard

CRS Score Factors:
- Age
- Education
- Work experience
- Language proficiency (English/French)
- Adaptability factors
- Spouse factors

Minimum Requirements:
- Language test (IELTS/CELPIP/TEF)
- Educational Credential Assessment (ECA)
- Proof of funds
- Medical exam
- Police certificate

documents.title: Skilled Worker Visa (Subclass 189/190/491)
documents.content:
Australian Skilled Worker Visas:

Subclass 189 (Skilled Independent):
- Points-based system
- No state/territory nomination required
- Permanent residency

Subclass 190 (Skilled Nominated):
- State/territory nomination required
- Permanent residency
- Must live in nominating state for 2 years

Subclass 491 (Skilled Work Regional):
- Regional area nomination
- 5-year temporary visa
- Pathway to permanent residency

Requirements:
- Age: Under 45 (usually)
- Skills assessment in nominated occupation
- English proficiency (IELTS 6.0 minimum, higher for more points)
- Points test: Minimum 65 points (higher scores more competitive)
- Health and character requirements
- Expression of Interest (EOI) in SkillSelect

Points Factors:
- Age
- English proficiency
- Work experience
- Education
- State nomination
- Partner skills
